page.title: 07ST.JAMES' CHURCH NANTGLYN.
page.content: The influence of religion in the area is strong with 5 active churches:the only Anglican one is in Nantglyn village.Dedicated to St. James it is 200 years old but there has been a church on the site for 700 years.The 6 century Celtic saint Modeyrn(sovereign of the sea) was supposed to have a chapel and well nearby. Famous men buried in the churchyard are Robert Davies(Bardd Nantglyn) and Dr. William Owen Pughe the translator and linguist of the early 19 century. There is a yew tree the girth of which is the linked outstretched hands of seven young schoolgirls. There are steps in the tree leading up to a pulpit said to have been used by John Wesley.
